articles.title: about these notes
articles.description: what's the sausage and how is it made?
articles.contents:
I am David Passmore.
how these notes are rendered
These NOTES originate in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, where I have lived
since 2020. I was a professor at Penn State for 41 years and in higher
education for 51 years. Additional details about my background,
experiences, and accomplishments
are
available elsewhere.
I write these NOTES in
RMarkdown
code in
RStudio
using blogging tools provided in the
R
programming package titled
distill.
I render the blog in
html
from the RMarkdown code. Then, I push the html to
my
GitHub account, from which it is served publicly through the
domain
name, davidpassmore.github.io/blog/. Cookies and other
tracking tools are not implemented on this blog site.
what’s here?
These NOTES cover a wide variety of topics that reflect the range of
ideas, learnings, and challenges that I encounter daily as I sit with my
computers at a table in front of the large windows that look over trees,
birds, and daily neighborhood activities from our 4th floor condo in the
Shadyside neighborhood of Pittsburgh.
how I engage
I live my days as a retired person. I rise at 4:00 am daily. Early
rising is not my attempt to follow some monastic way. No, see it as a
quiet time, an opportunity to organize and prepare, and a chance to have
a few accomplishments before the rest of the world starts moving. I meet
over my cup of morning coffee with long-time friends on Zoom from 6:30
to 7:30 am on Mondays through Saturdays.
The remainder of my time on most days is spent on projects selected
from too many to do. Sometimes I video conference with friends and
collaborators across the world. I am in a sleep research study that
requires that I get five hours of sleep per night, so I am asleep by
11:00 pm. Between rising and finally going to sleep, I do the
purchasing, shopping, bill-paying, cooking, laundering, medicating,
cleaning, banking, and so forth.
contacts with me
Friends, this blog is a gated community.
Send email to me using the email address:
dlp AT davidpassmore.net. I take iMsgs and SMS
messages at dlp@psu.edu. My Twitter handle is
@DLPPassmore, where I am available publicly. I also run
Slack teams for my former students and my family. In these
student and family teams, I typically am available instantly. I have
placeholder accounts in many social media apps, I do not do the
FaceBooks or the LinkedIns for anything meaningful.
So, not much of me is available on those apps. The telephone? Nah. I
almost never pick up, expect for family or for calls from close
associates. Calling me without leaving a message results in a blocked
calling number.1 I do use Instagram, but I
am deeply hidden and accessible by family only. I live in a secure
building, so, instead of making direct threats to me face-to-face, post
any expressions of unhappiness and ill-will to me via email or Twitter,
where I will work ideas into my life flow.
Vr,

Please note: my car warranty is as I
like it; my grandchildren do not require me to bail them out of jail;
the Internal Revenue Service is not trying to reach me urgently.↩︎
